hanzi-su-wiki:
節

Значения

Сустав; сочленение, сучок; мотив; пункт, часть, раздел; сезон; праздник; экономия, бережливость

Мнемоника

Коленце бамбука 竹, пригодное для еды 良 или изготовления бирок 卩. Коленце как часть мелодии; бамбуковый венок для новобрачной — символ целомудрия; бамбук как мера устрашения нечестных торговцев.

Варианты

节

koohiiStory1: Counting the nodes on bamboo is an instant way to tell its age.
koohiiStory2: A certain species of bamboo is considered the fastest growing plant in the world. A new node can be formed in an instant.
jp_example_words:
節(せつ): node, section, occasion, time
節約(せつやく): economising, saving
調節(ちょうせつ): regulation, adjustment, control

季節(きせつ): season
jp_readingExamples: 節約 (せつやく), 季節 (きせつ), 関節 (かんせつ), 節 (ふし)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: On the bottom of bamboo roots there is a stamp that tells the season in which it was cut. We've been putting these season stamps on bamboo, and later pretty much every perishable food, for a long, long time.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture yourself in a grocery store. You see a big pile of bamboo and pick each one up, checking the season stamps on their roots, to make sure you don't buy an old one.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: These season stamps are marked on bamboo sets (せつ). You can't buy a single banana or a single grape, and just like that, if you want some nice seasonal bamboo, you have to buy them in sets.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: How many bamboo sets will you be buying this season? I'm getting 42 sets.

humanum_full_description_en:
" Section " originally refers to the joints of bamboo, that is, the protruding parts of the joints of bamboo segments. "Shuowen": "Jie, bamboo about it. From bamboo, that is the sound." Gui Fu "Shuowen Jiezi Yizheng": "Yue said that the body has nine sections....Jiezi or Zhuo, bamboo spectrum bamboo The festival is said to be a dragon." "Historical Records. "Guisei Biography": "Bamboo, with joints on the outside, straight and empty in the middle."

" Jie " was first seen in the bronze inscriptions of the Warring States Period, starting with the sound of " bamboo " and " i ." " Jie " is a bamboo knot, and between two knot patterns is called a knot. In ancient times, it was used as a proof of identity and power. The cylindrical bamboo knot was cut in half and held by the emperor and deacon officials, or by the gatekeeper It is valid only if the two halves are the same if held by a privileged person. In the early days, the bamboo was broken as a festival, and later it was cast in bronze. It still took the shape of a bamboo knot, such as the Ejun Qizhou and Chejie in the Warring States Period, which were tax-free passes for water and land business. The tiger symbol can also be called " festival ". For example, the inscription of the tiger symbol of the doctor called himself "the festival of the doctor." It can be seen that " Fu " and " Jie " mean trustworthiness, meaning is the same in common, see " Fu ".

Since "Wen said," Dynasty, the word more books with " Ran ", " festival " as the ancient and modern words, in fact, under the guise of the word only to homonyms relationship. " Jie " a golden inscription elephant kneeling and sitting on the side of a human figure has no meaning for a symbol. " Jie " with a " ie ", " festival " of sound character, so "Wen said," with " Ran " to " section " character section as " Ran under the guise of righteousness" and " Ran ", " festival " in this non-word . In addition, due to the same sound, " jie " and " ie " are common. They are found on the bamboo slips and silk, indicating temperance, immediateness, etc. "Guodian Chu Jian. "Xing Ziming Out": "Experience its meaning and that is (section) of the text", "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Bamboo Slips. Japanese Book B": "The festival (that is) is based on the existence, and the center (suffering) does not come out of the year, the small and the big must be (to)."

The inscriptions of the Warring States Period mainly indicate the festival of symbols, and the boat festival and car festival seen in the inscriptions are the passes for business on water and land. "Ji Yun": "Festival, letter." E Junqi Car Festival: "See the golden festival, then no government (levy)", "If you don't see the golden festival, then the government (levy)", it can be seen that the car festival is tax-free. certificate. Symbols have different shapes and materials depending on the occasion. "Zhou Li. Land official. "Palm Festival": "Palm Festival, guard the state festival and distinguish its use, to assist the king's order. Those who guard the state use the jade festival, and those who guard the commonwealth use the horn festival. In the Employer’s Day, Ze Kingdom uses the Dragon Festival, which are all gold, and are supplemented by heroism. There is a period of anti-junctions for gates, seals for bribes, and jingles for roads. Anyone who can reach the world must have festivals. It is supplemented by transmission. Those who have no section will not reach it."

Bronze text also expresses restraint and restraint. King Zhongshan Hu: "Cast it as a Yi Hu, the festival is in the 禋妋𨣧. It can be honoured (method), and it is the god of the country to worship the ancestor." "Miscellaneous Gua": "Jie, stop." All things that stop but do not pass are called festivals, which are in line with the festival called "middle festival", and the festival says "lost festival". This is the origin of the meaning of season, etiquette, character, integrity, integrity, integrity, temperance, moderation, moderation, rhythm, ethics, moderation, frugality, and conservation (see the article's broad revision). " Festival " word more sentence examples refer to "easy", "Yi Zhou book", "Book of Rites", "Guang Ya" and so on.
humanum_short_description_en: The original meaning of " jie " is bamboo knot .
humanum_full_description:
「節」本指竹的節理，即竹子各段相連處突出的部位。《說文》：「節，竹約也。从竹，即聲。」桂馥《說文解字義證》：「約謂身有九節也。……節字或作箹，竹譜竹之節曰箹。」《史記．龜策列傳》：「竹，外有節理，中直空虛。」

　　「節」始見於戰國金文，從「竹」「即」聲，與小篆同。「節」是竹節，兩條節紋之間謂之一節；古時用作身份、權力的憑證，圓筒形的竹節剖成兩半，分由帝王及執事官員持有，或由守關者及獲特權人員持有，兩半吻合才有效。早期破竹為節，後以青銅鑄造，仍取象竹節之形，如戰國時期的鄂君啟舟、車節，是水、陸路經商的免稅通行證。而虎符亦可稱為「節」，如辟大夫虎符的銘文自稱為「辟大夫信節」。可見「符」、「節」表示憑信，義同通用，參見「符」。

　　自《說文》以降，字書多以「卪」、「節」為古今字，其實兩字只為同音假借關係。「卩」甲金文象跪坐人形的側面，並無符節之義。「卩」同是「即」、「節」的聲符，故《說文》以「卪」為「節」，符節為「卪」的假借義，「卪」、「節」本非一字。此外，由於音同，「節」、「即」通用，見於簡帛，表示節制、即刻等。《郭店楚簡．性自命出》：「體其義而即(節)文之」，《睡虎地秦簡．日書乙種》：「節(即)以有為也，其央(殃)不出歲，小大必致(至)。」

　　戰國金文主要表示符節，金文所見舟節、車節為於水、陸路經商的通行證。《集韻》：「節，信也。」鄂君啟車節：「見其金節，則毋政(徵)」，「不見其金節則政(徵)」，可見車節是免稅通行的憑證。符節因其場合而有不同形狀及質材。《周禮．地官．掌節》：「掌節，掌守邦節而辨其用，以輔王命。守邦國者用玉節，守都鄙者用角節。凡邦國之使節，山國用虎節，土國用人節，澤國用龍節，皆金也，以英蕩輔之。門關用符節，貨賄用璽節，道路用旌節，皆有期以反節。凡通達於天下者，必有節，以傳輔之。無節者，有幾則不達。」

　　金文又表示節制、約制。中山王壺：「鑄為彝壺，節于禋𨣧。可灋(法)可尚，以鄉上帝，以祀先王。」《易．雜卦》：「節，止也。」凡事之止而不過者皆曰節，合乎節曰「中節」，離乎節曰「失節」。此為時節、禮節、品節、志節、氣節、廉節、節制、節度、節文、節奏、節操、節義、節儉、節省之義所從出(參說文廣義校訂)。「節」字更多文例可參考《易》、《逸周書》、《禮記》、《廣雅》等。

①竹子或草木莖分枝長葉的部分：竹節。節外生枝。
②物體的分段或兩段之間連接的部分：關節。兩節車廂。
③段落，事項：節節(一段一段地，逐步)。節目。
④中國曆法把一年分爲二十四段，每段開始的名稱：節氣。節令。
⑤紀念日或慶祝宴樂的日子：節日。
⑥禮度：禮節。
⑦音調高低緩急的限度：節奏。節拍。節律。
⑧操守：節操。晚節。變節。高風亮節(高尚的品德和節操)。
⑨省減，限制：節省。節制。開源節流。
⑩略去，簡略：節選。節錄。
⑾古代出使外國所待的憑證：符節。使節。
⑿姓氏。

「 節 」本指竹的節理，即竹子各段相連處突出的部位。《說文》：「節，竹約也。从竹，即聲。」桂馥《說文解字義證》：「約謂身有九節也。……節字或作箹，竹譜竹之節曰箹。」《史記．龜策列傳》：「竹，外有節理，中直空虛。」 「 節 」始見於戰國金文，從「 竹 」「 即 」聲，與小篆同。「 節 」是竹節，兩條節紋之間謂之一節；古時用作身份、權力的憑證，圓筒形的竹節剖成兩半，分由帝王及執事官員持有，或由守關者及獲特權人員持有，兩半吻合才有效。早期破竹為節，後以青銅鑄造，仍取象竹節之形，如戰國時期的鄂君啟舟、車節，是水、陸路經商的免稅通行證。而虎符亦可稱為「 節 」，如辟大夫虎符的銘文自稱為「辟大夫信節」。可見「 符 」、「 節 」表示憑信，義同通用，參見「 符 」。 自《說文》以降，字書多以「 卪 」、「 節 」為古今字，其實兩字只為同音假借關係。「 卩 」甲金文象跪坐人形的側面，並無符節之義。「 卩 」同是「 即 」、「 節 」的聲符，故《說文》以「 卪 」為「 節 」，符節為「 卪 」的假借義，「 卪 」、「 節 」本非一字。此外，由於音同，「 節 」、「 即 」通用，見於簡帛，表示節制、即刻等。《郭店楚簡．性自命出》：「體其義而即(節)文之」，《睡虎地秦簡．日書乙種》：「節(即)以有為也，其央(殃)不出歲，小大必致(至)。」 戰國金文主要表示符節，金文所見舟節、車節為於水、陸路經商的通行證。《集韻》：「節，信也。」鄂君啟車節：「見其金節，則毋政(徵)」，「不見其金節則政(徵)」，可見車節是免稅通行的憑證。符節因其場合而有不同形狀及質材。《周禮．地官．掌節》：「掌節，掌守邦節而辨其用，以輔王命。守邦國者用玉節，守都鄙者用角節。凡邦國之使節，山國用虎節，土國用人節，澤國用龍節，皆金也，以英蕩輔之。門關用符節，貨賄用璽節，道路用旌節，皆有期以反節。凡通達於天下者，必有節，以傳輔之。無節者，有幾則不達。」 金文又表示節制、約制。中山王壺：「鑄為彝壺，節于禋𨣧。可灋(法)可尚，以鄉上帝，以祀先王。」《易．雜卦》：「節，止也。」凡事之止而不過者皆曰節，合乎節曰「中節」，離乎節曰「失節」。此為時節、禮節、品節、志節、氣節、廉節、節制、節度、節文、節奏、節操、節義、節儉、節省之義所從出(參說文廣義校訂)。「 節 」字更多文例可參考《易》、《逸周書》、《禮記》、《廣雅》等。
" Section" originally refers to the joints of bamboo, that is, the protruding parts of the joints of bamboo segments. "Shuowen": "Jie, bamboo about it. From bamboo, that is the sound." Gui Fu "Shuowen Jiezi Yizheng": "Yue said that the body has nine sections....Jiezi or Zhuo, bamboo spectrum bamboo The festival is said to be a dragon." "Historical Records. "Guisei Biography": "Bamboo, with joints on the outside, straight and empty in the middle." " Jie" was first seen in the bronze inscriptions of the Warring States Period, starting with the sound of " bamboo" and " i." " Jie" is a bamboo knot, and between two knot patterns is called a knot. In ancient times, it was used as a proof of identity and power. The cylindrical bamboo knot was cut in half and held by the emperor and deacon officials, or by the gatekeeper It is valid only if the two halves are the same if held by a privileged person. In the early days, the bamboo was broken as a festival, and later it was cast in bronze. It still took the shape of a bamboo knot, such as the Ejun Qizhou and Chejie in the Warring States Period, which were tax-free passes for water and land business. The tiger symbol can also be called " festival". For example, the inscription of the tiger symbol of the doctor called himself "the festival of the doctor." It can be seen that " Fu" and " Jie" mean trustworthiness, meaning is the same in common, see " Fu". Since "Wen said," Dynasty, the word more books with " Ran", " festival" as the ancient and modern words, in fact, under the guise of the word only to homonyms relationship. " Jie" a golden inscription elephant kneeling and sitting on the side of a human figure has no meaning for a symbol. " Jie" with a " ie", " festival" of sound character, so "Wen said," with " Ran" to " section" character section as " Ran under the guise of righteousness" and " Ran", " festival" in this non-word . In addition, due to the same sound, " jie" and " ie" are common. They are found on the bamboo slips and silk, indicating temperance, immediateness, etc. "Guodian Chu Jian. "Xing Ziming Out": "Experience its meaning and that is (section) of the text", "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Bamboo Slips. The inscriptions of the Warring States Period mainly indicate the festival of symbols, and the boat festival and car festival seen in the inscriptions are the passes for business on water and land. "Ji Yun": "Festival, letter." E Junqi Car Festival: "See the golden festival, then no government (levy)", "If you don't see the golden festival, then the government (levy)", it can be seen that the car festival is tax-free. certificate. Symbols have different shapes and materials depending on the occasion. "Zhou Li. Land official. "Palm Festival": "Palm Festival, guard the state festival and distinguish its use, to assist the king's order. Those who guard the state use the jade festival, and those who guard the commonwealth use the horn festival. In the Employer’s Day, Ze Kingdom uses the Dragon Festival, which are all gold, and are supplemented by heroism. There is a period of anti-junctions for gates, seals for bribes, and jingles for roads. Anyone who can reach the world must have festivals. It is supplemented by transmission. Those who have no section will not reach it." Bronze text also expresses restraint and restraint. King Zhongshan Hu: "Cast it as a Yi Hu, the festival is in the 禋妋𨣧. It can be honoured (method), and it is the god of the country to worship the ancestor." "Miscellaneous Gua": "Jie, stop." All things that stop but do not pass are called festivals, which are in line with the festival called "middle festival", and the festival says "lost festival". This is the origin of the meaning of season, etiquette, character, integrity, integrity, integrity, temperance, moderation, moderation, rhythm, ethics, moderation, frugality, and conservation (see the article's broad revision). 節字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jié］
［《廣韻》子結切，入屑，精。］
“节1”的繁体字。“卩1”的今字。
(1)竹节。
(2)泛指草木条干间坚实结节的部分。
(3)骨节。人身及动物骨骼联接的部分。
(4)事物的一端为一节。
(5)泛指事项。
(6)量词。
(7)节令；节日。古以立春、立夏、立秋、立冬及春分、秋分、夏至、冬至为八节；后分一年为二十四节。
(8)时期。
(9)符节。古代使臣所持以作凭证。
(10)气节；节操。
(11)志节；志向。
(12)礼节。
(13)法度；法则。
(14)节制；管束。
(15)节约；省俭。
(16)减除。
(17)指删节。
(18)一种古乐器。用两圆竹编成，上合下开，形似箕，可以拍之成声以节乐。
(19)节奏；节拍。
(20)适，适度。
(21)证验，验证。
(22)犹等。等级；等次。
(23)即斗栱。屋柱上端顶住横梁的木结构。
(24)六十四卦之一，兑下坎上。
(25)通“截”。高峻貌。
(26)国际通用

節字的康熙字典解释

【未集上】【竹字部】　節； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页891第24
〔古文〕卩【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?子結切，音接。【說文】竹節也。又操也。【左傳·成十五年】諸侯將見子臧于王而立之，子臧辭曰：前志有之曰：聖達節，次守節，下失節。爲君非吾節也。　又止也，檢也，制也。【易·頤象】君子以愼言語，節飮食。【疏】節，裁節。又【節卦】節亨。苦節不可貞。【疏】節者，制度之名，節止之義，制事有節，其道乃亨。又【說卦傳】節，止也。【書·康誥】節性惟日其邁。【禮·檀弓】品節斯。【註】制斷也。【爾雅·釋樂】和樂謂之節。【疏】八音克諧，無相奪倫，謂之和樂，樂和則應節。【左傳·莊二十三年】公如齊觀社，曹劌諫曰：會以訓上下之則，制財用之節。【史記·樂書】大禮與天地同節。【正義曰】天有日月，地有山川，高?如形，生用各別。大禮辯尊?貴賤等差異別，是大禮與天地同節。　又符節，所以示信。【書·康誥】惟厥正人越小臣諸節。【註】諸有符節之臣，若爲官行文書而有符，今之印者也。【周禮·地官】掌節，掌守邦節而辨其用，以輔王命。凡通達于天下者，必有節

(3) Condyles. The connecting part of the human body and animal bones.
(4) One end of a thing is a section.
(5) Refers generally to matters.
(6) Quantifiers.
(7) Seasons; festivals. In ancient times, the beginning of spring, the beginning of summer, the beginning of autumn, the beginning of winter and the vernal equinox, autumnal equinox, summer solstice, and winter solstice were eight festivals; the latter one was divided into twenty-four festivals.
(8) Period.
(9) Symbol section. The ancient envoys held it as a voucher.

(13) Law; law.

(15) Frugality; frugality.
(16) Subtract.
(17) Refers to abridgement.
(18) An ancient musical instrument. It is woven from two round bamboos, the top is closed and the bottom is opened.
(19) Rhythm; beat.
(20) Moderate, moderate.
(21) Verification and verification.
(22) Still waiting. Grade;
(23) That is Dougao. The upper ends of the roof pillars bear against the wooden structure of the beams.
(24) One of the sixty-four hexagrams, go up against the hurdle.
(25) Through "cut". Majestic appearance.

Section
Name meaning
Nothing.
jié, jiē
вм. 节
Radicals: 竹, 艮, 卩  (bamboo, root, stamp)
Meaning Mnemonic
On the bottom of bamboo roots there is a stamp that tells the season in which it was cut. We've been putting these season stamps on bamboo, and later pretty much every perishable food, for a long, long time.
Picture yourself in a grocery store. You see a big pile of bamboo and pick each one up, checking the season stamps on their roots, to make sure you don't buy an old one.
Reading Mnemonic
These season stamps are marked on bamboo sets (せつ). You can't buy a single banana or a single grape, and just like that, if you want some nice seasonal bamboo, you have to buy them in sets.
How many bamboo sets will you be buying this season? I'm getting 42 sets.
